items.title: Effective Altruism
items.desc: The community that taught me to ask: what's actually the most impactful thing I can do? Rigorous, quantitative, and asking the right questions.

items.title: Simon Institute for Longterm Governance
items.desc: Helping the international community navigate frontier AI. Where the rabbit hole from animal rights to EA to biosecurity eventually led.

items.title: Slate Star Codex / Astral Codex Ten
items.desc: The best blog on the internet. Psychiatry, prediction markets, coordination failures, and everything in between.

items.title: Cold Takes
items.desc: Long-form thinking about the most important century, AI, and how to navigate transformative change.

items.title: Carl Shulman
items.desc: Possibly the most careful thinker alive on AI trajectories and their implications. Rarely writes, always worth reading.

items.title: LessWrong
items.desc: The rationalist community's home base. Epistemics, AI alignment, decision theory. Dense but rewarding.

items.title: Sonia Calico
items.desc: Taiwanese DJ/producer. Experimental club, deconstructed, relentless energy.

items.title: Acid Pauli
items.desc: Psychedelic electronic music. Organic, deeply textured, impossible to sit still to.

items.title: Tyler, the Creator
items.desc: Genre-bending hip-hop auteur. From Goblin to CHROMAKOPIA â€” relentless creative evolution.

items.title: Donald Glover / Childish Gambino
items.desc: Music, film, comedy, writing. The closest thing to a modern renaissance human in pop culture.

items.title: Zugezogen Maskulin
items.desc: German rap with teeth. Political, sardonic, Berlin-raw.

items.title: Sense8
items.desc: Eight strangers across the world share consciousness. The most earnest show about human connection ever made.

items.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
items.desc: Multiverse absurdism that somehow becomes the most emotionally devastating film about kindness and laundry.

items.title: Hanabi
items.desc: Cooperative card game where you can see everyone's hand but your own. Pure coordination problem. Reveals how you communicate.

items.title: Secret Hitler
items.desc: Social deduction at its best. Trust, betrayal, and watching your friends lie to your face. Uncomfortably good training for real-world politics.

items.title: SIGG Bottle
items.desc: Swiss-made, indestructible, beautiful. The only water bottle you'll ever need.

items.title: Mobility Car-Sharing
items.desc: Switzerland's car-sharing network. 3,000+ vehicles, no ownership, works perfectly. The reason I don't own a car.
